      • synchronouslyUpdateViewOnUIThread

        public void synchronouslyUpdateViewOnUIThread(int reactTag,
                                              ReadableMap props)
        Description copied from interface: UIManager
        Used by native animated module to bypass the process of updating the values through the shadow view hierarchy. This method will directly update native views, which means that updates for layout-related propertied won't be handled properly. Make sure you know what you're doing before calling this method :)
        Specified by:
        synchronouslyUpdateViewOnUIThread in interface UIManager
        props - ReadableMap props that should be immediately updated in view

      • onHostResume

        public void onHostResume()
        Description copied from interface: LifecycleEventListener
        Called either when the host activity receives a resume event (e.g. Activity#onResume or if the native module that implements this is initialized while the host activity is already resumed. Always called for the most current activity.
        Specified by:
        onHostResume in interface LifecycleEventListener

        Called when host activity receives pause event (e.g. Activity#onPause. Always called for the most current activity.
        Specified by:
        onHostPause in interface LifecycleEventListener

      • onHostDestroy

        public void onHostDestroy()
        Description copied from interface: LifecycleEventListener
        Called when host activity receives destroy event (e.g. Activity#onDestroy. Only called for the last React activity to be destroyed.
        Specified by:
        onHostDestroy in interface LifecycleEventListener

      • dispatchCommand

        @Deprecated
public void dispatchCommand(int reactTag,
                                        int commandId,
                                        ReadableArray commandArgs)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: UIManager
        Dispatches the commandId received by parameter to the view associated with the reactTag. The command will be processed in the UIThread.

        Receiving commands as ints is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

        Pre-Fabric, this is only called on the Native Module Thread.

        Specified by:
        dispatchCommand in interface UIManager
        Parameters:
        reactTag - int that identifies the view that will receive this command
        commandId - int command id
        commandArgs - ReadableArray parameters associated with the command

      • dispatchCommand

        public void dispatchCommand(int reactTag,
                            java.lang.String commandId,
                            ReadableArray commandArgs)
        Description copied from interface: UIManager
        Dispatches the commandId received by parameter to the view associated with the reactTag. The command will be processed in the UIThread.

        Pre-Fabric, this is only called on the Native Module Thread.

        Specified by:
        dispatchCommand in interface UIManager
        Parameters:
        reactTag - int that identifies the view that will receive this command
        commandId - String command id
        commandArgs - ReadableArray parameters associated with the command

        public void sendAccessibilityEvent(int reactTag,
                                   int eventType)
        Description copied from interface: UIManager
        Dispatch an accessibility event to a view asynchronously.

        Pre-Fabric, this is only called on the Native Module Thread.

        Specified by:

      • setJSResponder

        public void setJSResponder(int reactTag,
                           int initialReactTag,
                           boolean blockNativeResponder)
        Set the JS responder for the view associated with the tags received as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        reactTag - React tag of the first parent of the view that is NOT virtual
        initialReactTag - React tag of the JS view that initiated the touch operation
        blockNativeResponder - If native responder should be blocked or not

      • clearJSResponder

        public void clearJSResponder()
        Clears the JS Responder specified by setJSResponder(int, int, boolean). After this method is called, all the touch events are going to be handled by JS.
